Subjects: A proverbial couplet; proverbs; translations; friendship

BodDou52.Transcription: ȝeue me & I the& so schul we frendes be
BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 44.

RylandsLat394.Transcription: ȝeue me and I theand so shull we frendes be
RylandsLat394.Note:
Written on one line; translates Est in amore fides stabilis cum dem
                        michi fides, which follows, f. 5v.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 95.
